page.title: 03MAINS SERVICES: ACTON/L`HAM
page.content: Electricity is generally available al- though some properties have only been supplied since 1957. Farms usually have stand-by generators. There is mains water but one farm relied on its own well until 1975. Outlying properties have no main drainage and rely on septic tanks. A large N.Sea gas main passes through the block but only certain properties in Lavenham are supplied with domestic gas. Refuse collection takes place. A former gravel pit in the area is used by the Local Authority for refuse disposal. Oil is the most common form of central heating. Wood-burning stoves are increasing in popularity.
